techmeme.title: Starlink says satellite internet kits purchased in one of six regions and activated in another may be subjected to a "outside region fee" of up to $300 (Andrew Liszewski/The Verge)
Reddit is winning over advertisers with interest-based targeting via subreddits, instead of personal data; analysis: Reddit's ad revenue to reach $1.1B+ in 2024 (Aisha Counts/Bloomberg)
A look at the fading dominance of Apple Podcasts, as a study of 603 weekly podcast consumers finds 31% use YouTube, followed by Spotify at 21%, and Apple at 12% (Ashley Carman/Bloomberg)
Sony Block Solutions Labs, a joint venture between Sony and Web3 developer Startale, launches Soneium, a Layer 2 blockchain for creators, developers, and more (Dean Takahashi/VentureBeat)
Chinese AI startups, cut off from the most powerful AI chips, are focusing on monetization, writing more efficient code for LLMs, and building smaller models (Wall Street Journal)
